On 17.04.2009, at 15:53, Mike Kelly wrote:
>

> Why then is Content-Language not treated as an accept-extension?

I don't know. It could have, but obviously people deemed it important  
enough to be handled separately.

>
> With your breaking change example, the media type isn't changing -  
> the version is. Is there any distinction there between document  
> schema and media type?

It's a matter of interpretation; I like to be able to group compatible  
formats together under the same media type. I've also grown fond of  
labeling related document types (in the XML complex type sense) with  
the same media type, i.e. instead of vnd.customer+xml and vnd.customers 
+xml I'll just use vnd.crm+xml for both <customer> and <customer-list>  
(appending a version when it matters). But I can see how one might  
come to a different decision depending on the use case.

Stefan
--
Stefan Tilkov, http://www.innoq.com/blog/st/
--Apple-Mail-215--319715168
